title: Atletico Madrid defender Lucas Hernandez ‘arrested on domestic abuse charge’ after police arrive in early hours
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments ATLETICO MADRID defender Lucas Hernandez has been arrested on a domestic abuse charge, according to multiple reports in Spain. 
The centre-back, 20, is alleged to have returned home drunk and got involved in a heated argument with his girlfriend – who was later taken to hospital after he ‘beat’ her. EPA Atletico Madrid defender Lucas Hernandez has been arrested after an alleged assault on his girlfriend Getty Images The 20-year-old is expected to appear at a magistrates court on Friday morning 
The injuries are not thought to be serious and she has not yet filed a complaint. 
Police arrived at Hernandez’s home in the swanky Molino de la Hoz at around 2.30am on Friday morning. 
The France U21 international is said to have left without any resistance, before being transferred to the Civil Guard. Getty Images Hernandez is seen as a potential star at Atletico 
He remained in custody overnight. 
According to Spanish newspaper El Pais , Hernandez will be moved to Majadahonda magistrates court where a judge will determine if a criminal proceeding is to be initiated. 
The judge could also hand the centre-back a restraining order and prohibit him from communicating with the woman. Lucas’ father Jean-Francois was also a professional footballer, playing for Atletico Madrid in 2000-01. 
The defender was born in Marseille, while his dad played there in Ligue 1. 
He came through the youth ranks at Atletico , making his first team in December 2014. 
The 20-year-old has had to bide his time under Diego Simeone, playing just 15 league matches in the last two seasons. 
However, he is seen as a massive part of the club’s future. 
Hernandez came on in extra-time of the Champions League final against rivals Real Madrid last May.
